content.description:
Weapons Grade is a small obvious overhanging cave that is just right of the Campus Problem (V2). Sit start on two very tiny left facing side pull crimps, situate feet and power up to the right hand gaston. Cross into a seemly in-obvious hold placement with the left and power into slopers and move left to a jug top out. 

  One of the hardest problems in Groom Creek, reported to be between V11-V12 and has only seen a handful of ascents (4-5). ***Recent new beta was found on the problem, dropping it down to more around v10/11 and slghtly more doable finishing moves than the original beta.
content.location: Right of Campus Problem but on same boulder.

content.description: Sit-down start at obvious, heavily chalked incuts and climb the flake up and right to apex.  Long dynamic move around the lip and then you're up!
content.protection: Clean fall, but a little high for some people.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Begin SDS at the beginning to the Wave and instead of heading over the lip, continue right along the obvious hand rail, around a flake and then up to a big juggy finish.  Positive holds the whole way keep you safely off the scary looking boulder.
content.protection: When in doubt just step off to the backbreaker boulder.  It can be your friend!
content.location: From main trail coming up from the school bus turnaround head up right to the obvious overhanging "Wave" boulder once you reach the main area.

content.description: Tiny edges and smears lead to a sloping top-out. Excellent training for slab technique!
content.location: The Mini Slab is WNW from Wave Rock - peek around the corner from the Wave and you'll see the backside as a huge flat slab of rock.

content.description: Pull up over the left-leaning crack on small edges and smears. Mantle top-out with good hands.
content.location: The Mini Slab is WNW from Wave Rock - peek around the corner from the Wave and you'll see the backside as a huge flat slab of rock.

content.description: Smears and a couple of good handholds to a mantle top-out. Great for footwork improvement.
content.location: The Mini Slab is WNW from Wave Rock - peek around the corner from the Wave and you'll see the backside as a huge flat slab of rock.

content.description: Lieback and smear on a protruding flake.
content.location: Obvious flake on the west side of Wave Rock. Mantle top-out and easy walk off.

content.description: Obvious lieback problem next to Classic Crack
content.location: Directly south of The Wave on same boulder as Classic Crack

content.description:
Same sit-down start as for the Wave, but cut left out to the arete on obvious crimps to big sidepulls around the corner. Crux is getting feet set up high for the long reach to the top.

 Variations include starting further out to the right and traversing below the Wave and up into Frogger.
content.protection: Beware the ankle-breaker roots at the base.

content.description: Crack problem just south of Wave/Campus boulders (closer to the parking area) near power lines.
Traverse left to thin face with small pocket. #27 on the Marty Map.

Start at Classic Crack. Traverse foot ledge left following a faint seam with meager holds ending at a large side pull near a tree. Top out featureless friction slab, just right of tree. Likely harder these days, seems a large portion of the foot ledge has broke. Prove your GC rock mastery on this over-looked classic.
The Wave Area includes The Wave Boulder, The Campus Boulder, split Rock.
